H0.text: Observing the plants and recording observations daily is how the students should carry out their investigation after potting the plants in the four different types of soil to determine if plant growth is affected.

H1.text: Moving the plants to new locations every day is the best method for students to carry out their investigation after potting the plants in the four different types of soil to determine whether plant growth is affected by soil type.

H2.text: Measuring the height of each plant every hour is the best way for students to carry out the investigation after potting the plants in the four different types of soil to determine if plant growth is affected.

H3.text: Adding different amounts of water to each plant is the best method for students to conduct the investigation after potting the plants in four different types of soil to determine whether plant growth is affected.

A5.text: The experimental design may also identify control variables that must be held constant to prevent external factors from affecting the results

A6.text: The pH of the culture medium is adjusted to between 5.6 and 5.8 before sterilization.

A7.text: Temperature serves as a critical environmental factor in plant tissue culture systems, with optimal incubation temperatures varying significantly among species based on their natural habitat requirements.
